Summer Leadership Challenge (SLC) is a leadership development program that encourages exploration, independence and personal growth. Young people participate in interactive workshops that prepare them for leadership roles and employment. Our goal is to empower participants to effect positive changes within themselves and within their community. Young people will learn about employment opportunities they can pursue and become competent in leading others in activities. Each session concludes with participants coordinating and implementing a capstone project benefiting the local community. In addition to developing useful skills, participants will earn service learning hours and receive individual evaluations. At Summer Leadership Challenge, young people will establish lasting friendships, develop a sense of responsibility, learn to work effectively in groups, build accountability, and gain the confidence to solve problems independently. Participants will also receive an opportunity to earn CPR and First Aid certification. You may only register for and participate in one (1) session of SLC. Participants may earn up to 35 SSL hours for the session. No transportation is available.
